law.catch_line: An employee may use work-related accident leave:...

text.section:
An employee may use work-related accident leave:
beginning on the first day of disability; and
continuing until the earlier of:
the day that the employee is able to return to work, as certified by a physician; or
6 months from the day of disability.

After an employee returns to work, work-related accident leave may be granted for continuing treatment as certified by a physician selected by the appointing authority up to 6 months from the day of the original disability.

Work-related accident leave may be granted for up to an additional 6 months if:
the employee is certified by a physician selected or accepted by the appointing authority; and
no decision has been reached by the Workers' Compensation Commission on the employee's claim.
